author: Redwoodtj
body:
### Checklist

- [x] Verify that [`PowerShell-Native`](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-Native) has been updated / released as needed.
- [x] Check for `PowerShellGet` and `PackageManagement` release plans.
- [x] Start process to sync Azure DevOps artifacts feed such as modules and NuGet packages.
- [x] Create a private branch named `release/v6.x.x` in Azure DevOps repository.
  All release related changes should happen in this branch.
- [x] Prepare packages
    - [x] Kick off coordinated build.
- [x] Kick off Release pipeline.
    - *These tasks are orchestrated by the release pipeline, but here as status to the community.*
    - [x] Prepare packages
        - [x] Sign the RPM package.
        - [x] Install and verify the packages.
        - [x] Trigger the docker staging builds (signing must be done).
    - [x] Create the release tag and push the tag to `PowerShell/PowerShell` repository.
    - [x] Run tests on all supported Linux distributions and publish results.
    - [x] Update documentation, and scripts.
        - [x] Update [CHANGELOG.md](../../CHANGELOG.md) with the finalized change log draft.
        - [x] Stage a PR to master to update other documents and
              scripts to use the new package names, links, and `metadata.json`.
    - [x] For preview releases,
      merge the release branch to GitHub `master` with a merge commit.
    - [x] For non-preview releases,
      make sure all changes are either already in master or have a PR open.
    - [ ] Delete the release branch.
    - [x] Trigger the Docker image release.
    - [x] Retain builds.
    - [x] Update https://github.com/dotnet/dotnet-docker/tree/master/3.0/sdk with new version and SHA hashes for global tool. NOTE: this link is broken!

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: This does not appear to be a real issue

title: Release Process for v7.x.x
